detaileddescription.para: Obtain this by reading first header.

briefdescription.para: Endianness of the data being read.
Initial position of buffer (0 if file).
Constructor for reading an event file.

parameterdescription.para: the full path to the file that contains events. For writing event files, use an EventWriter object.
if true use mutex to make threadsafe.
if read failure
if path arg is empty

briefdescription.para: Constructor for reading a buffer with option of removing synchronization for much greater speed.

detaileddescription.para: The proper buffer format, in evio version 6, is NOT the file format which contains a file header, but only the regular records. The proper format in earlier versions is the same for files as it is for buffers - with regular blocks.

parameterdescription.para: the buffer that contains events.
if true use mutex to make threadsafe.
if not enough buffer data;
if buffer arg is null; failure to parse first block header; unsupported evio version.

para.para: Is this reader reading a file?

simplesect.para: true if reading file, false if reading buffer

para.para: Is the data in the file/buffer compressed?

simplesect.para: true if data is compressed.

para.para: This method can be used to avoid creating additional EvioCompactReader objects by reusing this one with another buffer.
The method close() should be called before calling this.

parameterdescription.para: ByteBuffer to be read
if arg is null; if failure to read first block header; if buffer not in evio format.

simplesect.para: true if this object closed, elsefalse .

para.para: Get the path to the file.

para.para: When reading a file, this method's return value is the byte order of the evio data in the file.

simplesect.para: byte order of the evio data in the file.

para.para: Get the XML format dictionary is there is one.

parameterdescription.para: if object closed and dictionary still unread

simplesect.para: XML format dictionary, else null.

para.para: Get the evio dictionary if is there is one.

parameterdescription.para: if object closed and dictionary still unread

simplesect.para: evio dictionary if exists, else null.

para.para: Does this evio file have an associated XML dictionary?

simplesect.para: true if this evio file has an associated XML dictionary, else false

para.para: Get the byte buffer being read directly or corresponding to the event file.

simplesect.para: the byte buffer being read directly or corresponding to the event file.

para.para: Get the size of the file being read, in bytes.

For small files, obtain the file size using the memory mapped buffer's capacity.
the file size in bytes

memberdef.name: searchEvent

tag to match.
num to match.
vector to be filled with matching evio structures (empty if none found).
if bad arg value(s); if object closed

memberdef.name: searchEvent

para.para: This method searches the specified event in a file/buffer and returns a vector of objects each of which contain information about a single evio structure which matches the given dictionary entry name.

parameterdescription.para: place of event in buffer (starting with 1)
name of dictionary entry to search for
dictionary to use; if null, use dictionary with file/buffer
vector to be filled with matching evio structures (empty if none found).
if dictName is null; if dictName is an invalid dictionary entry; if dictionary is null and none provided in file/buffer being read; if object closed

para.para: This method removes the data of the given event from the buffer.
It also marks any existing EvioNodes representing the event and its descendants as obsolete. They must not be used anymore.

If the constructor of this reader read in data from a file, it will now switch to using a new, internal buffer which is returned by this method or can be retrieved by calling getByteBuffer(). It will not change the file originally used. A new file can be created by calling either the toFile(std::string const &) method.

parameterdescription.para: number of event to remove from buffer

simplesect.para: new ByteBuffer created and updated to reflect the event removal

parameterdescription.para: if evNumber < 1; if event number does not correspond to existing event; if object closed; if node was not found in any event; if internal programming error

para.para: This method removes the data, represented by the given node, from the buffer.
It also marks the node and its descendants as obsolete. They must not be used anymore.

If the constructor of this reader read in data from a file, it will now switch to using a new, internal buffer which is returned by this method or can be retrieved by calling getByteBuffer(). It will not change the file originally used. A new file can be created by calling either the toFile(std::string const &) method.

parameterdescription.para: evio structure to remove from buffer

simplesect.para: new ByteBuffer (perhaps created) and updated to reflect the node removal

parameterdescription.para: if object closed; if node was not found in any event; if internal programming error

para.para: This method adds an evio container (bank, segment, or tag segment) as the last structure contained in an event.

It is the responsibility of the caller to make sure that the buffer argument contains valid evio data (only data representing the structure to be added - not in file format with block header and the like) which is compatible with the type of data stored in the given event.
To produce such evio data use EvioBank#write(ByteBuffer &), EvioSegment#write(ByteBuffer &) or EvioTagSegment#write(ByteBuffer &) depending on whether a bank, seg, or tagseg is being added.

A note about files here. If the constructor of this reader read in data from a file, it will now switch to using a new, internal buffer which is returned by this method or can be retrieved by calling getByteBuffer(). It will not expand the file originally used. A new file can be created by calling either the toFile(std::string const &) method.
The given buffer argument must be ready to read with its position and limit defining the limits of the data to copy. This method is synchronized due to the bulk, relative puts.

parameterdescription.para: number of event to which addBuffer is to be added
buffer containing evio data to add (not evio file format, i.e. no block headers)

simplesect.para: a new ByteBuffer object which is created and filled with all the data including what was just added.

parameterdescription.para: if evNumber < 1; if addBuffer is null; if addBuffer arg is empty or has non-evio format; if addBuffer is opposite endian to current event buffer; if added data is not the proper length (i.e. multiple of 4 bytes); if the event number does not correspond to an existing event; if there is an internal programming error; if object closed

para.para: Get the data associated with an evio structure in ByteBuffer form.
The returned buffer is a view into this reader's buffer (no copy done). Changes in one will affect the other.

parameterdescription.para: evio structure whose data is to be retrieved
if object closed or node arg is null.

simplesect.para: ByteBuffer filled with data.

Depending on the copy argument, the given/returned buffer will either be a copy of or a view into the data of this reader's buffer.
This method is synchronized due to the bulk, relative gets & puts.

if true, then return a copy as opposed to a view into this reader object's buffer.
if object closed

simplesect.para: ByteBuffer filled with data.

parameterdescription.para: evio structure whose data is to be retrieved
user-supplied ByteBuffer to be filled with data.
if object closed or node arg is null.

memberdef.name: getData

para.para: Get the data associated with an evio structure in ByteBuffer form.
Depending on the copy argument, the given/returned buffer will either be a copy of or a view into the data of this reader's buffer.
This method is synchronized due to the bulk, relative gets & puts.

parameterdescription.para: evio structure whose data is to be retrieved
user-supplied ByteBuffer to be filled with data.
if true, then return a copy as opposed to a view into this reader object's buffer.
if object closed

para.para: This sets the position to its initial value and marks reader as closed.
This is the number of events in the file/buffer.
Any dictionary event is not included in the count. In versions 3 and earlier, it is not computed unless asked for, and if asked for it is computed and cached.

simplesect.para: the number of events in the file/buffer.

para.para: This is the number of blocks in the file/buffer including the empty block at the end.

simplesect.para: the number of blocks in the file/buffer (estimate for version 3 files)

para.para: Save the internal byte buffer to the given file (overwrites existing file).

parameterdescription.para: name of file to write
if error writing to file
if fileName arg is null; if object closed

briefdescription.para: This class is used to read an evio formatted file or buffer and extract specific evio containers (bank, seg, or tagseg) with actual data in them given a tag/num pair.

detaileddescription.para: It is theoretically thread-safe if sync is true. It is designed to be fast and does NOT do a full deserialization on each event examined.

simplesect.para: timmer
